definitions.definition: The structural elements of a building or other constructed object.
definitions.example: Now that the frame is complete, we can start on the walls.

definitions.definition: Anything composed of parts fitted and united together; a fabric; a structure.
The structure of a person's body; the human body.
definitions.example: His starved flesh hung loosely on his once imposing frame.

definitions.definition: A rigid, generally rectangular mounting for paper, canvas or other flexible material.
definitions.example: The painting was housed in a beautifully carved frame.

definitions.definition: A piece of photographic film containing an image.
definitions.example: A film projector shows many frames in a single second.

definitions.definition: A context for understanding or interpretation.
definitions.example: In this frame, it's easy to ask the question that the investigators missed.

definitions.definition: A complete game of snooker, from break-off until all the balls (or as many as necessary to win) have been potted.
An independent chunk of data sent over a network.

A set of balls whose results are added together for scoring purposes. Usually two balls, but only one ball in the case of a strike, and three balls in the case of a strike or a spare in the last frame of a game.
A movable structure used for the cultivation or the sheltering of plants.
The outer decorated portion of a stamp's image, often repeated on several issues although the inner picture may change.
The outer circle of a cancellation mark.
A division of time on a multimedia timeline, such as 1/30th or 1/60th of a second.
An individually scrollable region of a webpage.
An inning.
Any of certain machines built upon or within framework.
definitions.example: a stocking frame; a lace frame; a spinning frame

definitions.definition: Frame of mind; disposition.
definitions.example: to be always in a happy frame

definitions.definition: Contrivance; the act of devising or scheming.
A stage or level of a video game.
("reading frame") A way of dividing nucleotide sequences into a set of consecutive triplets.
A form of knowledge representation in artificial intelligence.
A complete lattice in which meets distribute over arbitrary joins.
To fit, as for a specific end or purpose; make suitable or comfortable; adapt; adjust.
To construct by fitting or uniting together various parts; fabricate by union of constituent parts.
To bring or put into form or order; adjust the parts or elements of; compose; contrive; plan; devise.
Of a constructed object such as a building, to put together the structural elements.
definitions.example: Once we finish framing the house, we'll hang tin on the roof.

definitions.definition: Of a picture such as a painting or photograph, to place inside a decorative border.
To position visually within a fixed boundary.
definitions.example: The director frames the fishing scene very well.

definitions.definition: To construct in words so as to establish a context for understanding or interpretation.
definitions.example: How would you frame your accomplishments?

definitions.definition: Conspire to incriminate falsely a presumably innocent person. See frameup.
definitions.example: The gun had obviously been placed in her car in an effort to frame her.

definitions.definition: To wash ore with the aid of a frame.
To move.
To proceed; to go.
To hit (the ball) with the frame of the racquet rather than the strings (normally a mishit).
To strengthen; refresh; support.
To execute; perform.
definitions.example: All have sworn him an oath that they should frame his will on earth.

definitions.definition: To cause; to bring about; to produce.
To profit; avail.
To fit; accord.
To succeed in doing or trying to do something; manage.
